entityId.localType: National Archives of Australia Reference Number

nameEntry.part: John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations

biogHist.abstract: 'John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations' is a file held by the National Archives of Australia. The file documents the responses from Children's Homes, State child welfare authorities, sending and receiving agencies to recommendations made by Mr John Moss CBE a 'UK Child Expert' who worked for the Home Office in Britain. Moss visited Australia and New Zealand and examined the Homes and support systems for child migrants from Britain.
biogHist.p: Information in the file, 'John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations' refers to the following matters:

list.item: Registration a new name for British migrant children who were adopted by Australians
Including Australian-born children in Homes with British child migrants
Type of 'case histories' that came with the children from Britain

cpfRelation.relationEntry: National Archives of Australia - Contact Details
Child and Youth Migration to Western Australia (1913 - 1968)
Moss Visit and Report [British child migration] (1951)

archref.unittitle: Moss Report Implementation [Excerpt] - Methodist Homes for Children
archref.abstract: This is an excerpt from the digital copy of the John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a letter from the Child Welfare Department in Western Australia. This excerpt from the letter refers to pocket money for British child migrants at the Methodist Homes for Children.

This is an excerpt from the digital copy of the John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations from the National Archives of Australia website. It gives information about the pocket money for their voyage, supplied to child migrants coming from Britain to Swan Homes.

This is an excerpt from the digital copy of the John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a letter from the Child Welfare Department in Western Australia. The letter gives a brief summary of the types of health examinations that were planned to be undertaken in institutions receiving child migrants from Britain after World War Two. These institutions were the Anglican Homes (Swan Homes), the Methodist Home for Children, Fairbridge Farm School and the Catholic Episcopal Migration and Welfare Association. An example of the letter sent to all institutions is included in this excerpt from the file.

This is an excerpt from the digital copy of the John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations from the National Archives of Australia website. It has information about the Fairbridge Farm School at Pinjarra in Western Australia.

This is an excerpt from the digital copy of the John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a brief summary of the types and amount of pocket money which the Australian institutions reportedly gave to child migrants from Britain. These institutions were the Anglican Homes (Swan Homes), the Methodist Home for Children, Fairbridge Farm School and the Catholic Episcopal Migration and Welfare Association.

This is an excerpt from the digital copy of the John Moss Report on Child Migration - Implementation of Recommendations from the National Archives of Australia website. It is a letter from the Child Welfare Department in Western Australia. The letter gives a brief summary of the types of 'case history' information that was sent to the institutions receiving child migrants from Britain after World War Two. These institutions were the Anglican Homes (Swan Homes), the Methodist Home for Children, Fairbridge Farm School and the Catholic Episcopal Migration and Welfare Association.
